instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.BKLT_PWM: What is BKLT_PWM? BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKLT_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.A2289: What is A2289? A2289 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3456, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01987..
definitions.820-00452: What is 820-00452? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: 2018 Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with dim display output
threads.message:
I have this 2019 Pro that shows a very dim backlight (it's there but about 1/10 the brightness of normal). After a NVRAM reset, the backlight displays at full brightness during the first half of the boot process, then reverts back to dim.

<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> is constant around 44 V, before and after dimming.
<SIGNAL>BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> is 2.5 V during full brightness, and 0.01V during dimming.

I don't have another 2018 display but I tested with a 2017 display and it gave the same results. What's next to check on this board?

threads.title: 2018 Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with dim display output
2018 Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with dim display output
threads.message: Yes, I tried DFU Revive, which didn't change anything.

threads.title: 2018 Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with dim display output
threads.message: Save data (if needed) and do DFU restore, with full macOS installation.

threads.title: 2018 Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with dim display output
threads.message: Ok, did that. No change. As soon as the OS loads, the display dims.

threads.title: 2018 Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with dim display output
2018 Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with dim display output
threads.message: I'm running all tests with camera flex cable disconnected... it's not the ALS for sure.

threads.title: 2018 Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with dim display output
threads.message: I (accidentally) found out that when I connect one or more of the LED return lines in the backlight flex cable to ground, the brightness (almost full) returns. Is that expectedâ€¦ is that how PWM works in these displays?

threads.title: 2018 Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with dim display output
threads.message:
Shouldn't be LED return issue, if backlight is correct when machine starts.
Looks more like ALS issue, as its driver is loaded into macOS.

How did you discard an ALS problem located on the MLB?
Check if ALS really works; KB backlight reaction may help.

threads.title: 2018 Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with dim display output
threads.message:
You're right, it could be an ALS issue on the logic board. 

With the original 2018 display, I get constant keyboard backlight and screen brightness doesn't change with ambient light. Camera works.

threads.title: 2018 Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with dim display output
threads.message:
Found the culprit. Someone had installed a 2017 display (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00452</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05) on this machine. This explains the dimness and lack of ALS.

I tried a 2020 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> display and it functions perfectly.

Always test with a compatible screen! See [URL]https://logi.wiki/index.php/MacBook_LCD_Screen_Compatibility[/URL] for known screen issues.
